title: S.C. Judge Rules 1944 Execution Of 14-Year-Old Boy Was Wrong
teaser: An African-American boy, George Stinney Jr., who was executed in the killing of two young white girls has been exonerated, 70 years after he became the youngest person executed in the U.S.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
